content.description: In a certain board game, a player rolls two fair six-sided dice until the player rolls doubles (where the value on each die is the same). The probability of rolling doubles with one roll of two fair six-sided dice is <math alttext="one sixth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What is the probability that it takes three rolls until the player rolls doubles?

choices.label: <math alttext="one sixth times five sixths cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one sixth times five sixths squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="five sixths times one sixth squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one sixth times five sixths squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
